data.title: Second half playbook: Tech poised to outperform?
data.text: CNBC’s Josh Lipton takes a look at what’s in store for tech in the second half of 2019.

data.title: 2 Hot Stocks to Watch in July
data.text: These two companies' stocks have skyrocketed this year. Can they keep impressing investors?

data.title: Here's why countries are taking on Big Tech
data.text: Mike Isaac, NYTimes tech reporter, and Wolfe Research analyst Steve Milunovich join "Squawk Alley" to discuss Big Tech being under fire in Europe and what it means for the industry as it continues to grow.

data.title: How Facebook's Libra could lead you to clean out your wallet
data.text: Facebook's upcoming cryptocurrency Libra has some experts concerned about security issues. A possible bigger problem: out-of-control spending by consumers.

data.title: Finally, some good news that both Facebook users and investors can get behind
data.text: Are you a social-media aficionado or investor? If so, this new research on Facebook is unlikely to make you feel depressed.

data.title: French lawmakers back fines for companies like Facebook and Google that leave hate speech online
data.text: French lawmakers backed a bill Thursday that would wage fines on platforms and search engines that fail to remove hate speech after 24 hours.

data.title: Facebook fixes Instagram, WhatsApp outages
data.text: The "Squawk Box" crew talk about several of the morning's top stories.

data.title: Wikipedia co-founder slams Mark Zuckerberg, Twitter and the 'appalling' internet
data.text: Wikipedia Co-Founder Larry Sanger said social media companies like Facebook and Twitter exploit users' personal data resulting in "massive violations" of privacy and security.

data.title: Facebook ads funded by 'dark money' are the right's weapon for 2020
data.text: The right and conservative media are using the untraceable ads to push a rightwing agenda and get Donald Trump re-elected
